subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... Sounds excessively complicated for little benefit. For one thing, there may be circular dependencies. The more complicated the system the more likely this
messageBody:
Cedric Beust wrote:

> Right, so I want the testing framework to *not* run any test method that
> depends on rectangle drawing because it's a waste of time. And I also want
> the final report to let me know that all these test methods were skipped.

Sounds excessively complicated for little benefit. For one thing, there
may be circular dependencies. The more complicated the system the more
likely this is. For another, it's not always obvious what depends on
what. Trying to figure out the dependencies feel like more trouble than
it's worth. In practice, I almost alway just look at the last change I
made. Normally it's obvious what I broke and how. Even in the occasional
case where it isn't obvious, I still know the change that caused the
breakage so I'll figure it out eventually. Finding the change that broke
the tests is 90% of fixing the problem. As long as we're testing
frequently, you can't make too many changes before noticing the breakage.
